verses.roman:
upaniṣadera karena mukhyārtha vyākhyāna
śuniyā paṇḍita-lokera juḍāya mana-kāṇa

synonyms: upaniṣadera—of the Vedic version known as the Upaniṣads; karena—He does; mukhya-artha—the original meaning; vyākhyāna—explanation; śuniyā—hearing; paṇḍita-lokera—of the learned scholars; juḍāya—satisfies; mana-kāṇa—the minds and ears.
translation: "Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu explains the direct meaning of the Upaniṣads. When all learned scholars hear this, their minds and ears are satisfied.
